definition: guardian lion, a lion statue traditionally placed at the entrance of Chinese imperial palaces, imperial tombs, temples etc
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
lion
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He lifted at a heavy stone lion.
sentences.chinese: 他用力举起一座沉重的石狮子。

sentences.english: The two stone lions by the Gate of Tian'anmen, one on each side were meant as sentries.
sentences.chinese: 这两个石狮子的门天安门，每方都意味着作为哨兵。

sentences.english: Temple sitting West headed east, on both sides of the gate-two stone lions and two Shek Kwu.
sentences.chinese: 寺坐西朝东，山门两侧各放两只石狮子和两只石鼓。

sentences.english: Two stone lions, cold and aloof, stand beside in front of the gate.
sentences.chinese: 门口蹲着两个大石狮子，严峻冷漠。

sentences.english: The mighty stone lion is sculpted out of large stone.
sentences.chinese: 威武的石狮子是用大石头雕成的。

sentences.english: The majestic stone lions symbolizing the courthouse lords are sacred and inviolable.
sentences.chinese: 威严的石狮子彰显着法院老爷的神圣不可侵犯。

sentences.english: Outside the gate of some large siheyuan, there is a pair of stone lions on each side.
sentences.chinese: 在门外的一些大型四合院，有一对石狮子，每一边的。

sentences.english: Are you also familiar with this pair of stone lions?
sentences.chinese: 那不知道这对石狮子你熟不熟啊？

sentences.english: Beijing now has many stone lions made during the Ming and Qing dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 北京现存有不少明清两代的石狮子。

sentences.english: These stone lions look a bit different from those I've seen in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 这个好像跟北京的石狮子相比还是有一些差别。

sentences.english: As if a stone lion shot out a fissured emerald bead covered with saliva.
sentences.chinese: 像石狮子吐出裂痕斑驳，沾满涎水的翡翠色石珠。

sentences.english: The two stone lions, of grotesque shape, guard the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 两只形态奇异的石狮子守卫着入口处。

sentences.english: These lions usually come in pairs, with the male on the right and female on the left.
sentences.chinese: 这些石狮子大多成双成对，公的在右，母的在左。

sentences.english: It had two large stone lions, one male, one female.
sentences.chinese: 门前是一公一母两个大石狮子。

sentences.english: Two stone lions, cold and aloof, stand besides in front of the gate.
sentences.chinese: 门口蹲着两个大石狮子，严峻冷漠。

definition: wooden or stone block supporting the axle of a door
a screen wall across the gate of a house (for privacy)
stone carving/carved sculpture
spirit wall (screen wall used to shield an entrance in traditional Chinese architecture)
decorated archway
see 石獅子|石狮子[shi2 shi1 zi5]
Shishi county level city in Quanzhou 泉州[Quan2 zhou1], Fujian
(traditional) red paint/red lacquer
white marble/a type of white marble used for building and sculpting
auspicious animal (such as the dragon)
memorial arch
holder for door knocker
stone statue
door knocker (in the shape of a ring)
stele/stone tablet (for inscription)/CL:方[fang1]
marble pillar (ornamental column in front of places, tombs)
a horizontal inscribed board
